parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

extension.name: XML
extension.description: A Mule Module which provides functionality to handle XML. This module should be used for advanced use cases or use cases associated with XML standards such as XSLT, XPath and XQuery or XSD. Take in mind that DataWeave is not only perfectly capable to handle most of those use cases and can replace those standards the majority of the times, but it's also our recommended approach.

operation.name: validateSchema

parameter.name: schemaLanguage
parameter.description: The schema language to use.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: the XML content to validate

operation.name: xpathExtract
operation.description:
Evaluates an XPath expression the input content and returns the result.

Because XPath expressions can match any number of individual elements, this operation returns a List of Strings. If no element matched the expression, an empty list will be returned.

XPath expressions are also namespace aware, which is why this operation allows setting namespace mappings. These mappings will be merged with those optionally defined in the referenced namespace-directory, meaning that the evaluation will combine both sets of namespace mappings.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: the XML content on which the XPath is evaluated

parameter.name: xpath
parameter.description: the XPath script

parameter.name: contextProperties
parameter.description: Properties that wil be made available to the transform context.

parameter.name: namespaces
parameter.description: namespace mappings that will be used in this evaluation. They will be combined with the ones in the config element

parameter.name: namespaceDirectory
parameter.description: the namespace directory from which take base namespace mappings

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
